repository.orgName: Bibliothèque nationale de France. Département des Manuscrits

summary.p:
A multiple-text manuscript, possibly a collective production by several copyists, unless it is a composite manuscript. The bundle contains 21 works, in the following order:
The Civappirakācam (U3a = Indien 948.1).
The Tēvikālōttaram (U3b = Indien 948.2).
The Kurumoḻiviṉāval (U3c.1, Indien 948.3).
The Cacivarṇapōtam (U3c.2 = Indien 948.4).
The Cukātītacintu (U3c.3 = Indien 948.5).
The Antariyāka Pūcaiyaṭṭavaṇai (U3c.4 = Indien 948.6).
The Anuṭṭāṉavakaval (U3c.5 = Indien 948.7).
The Uṟcakaviḷakkam (U3c.6 = Indien 948.8).
The Anupūtiviḷakkam (U3c.7 = Indien 948.9).
The Ciṟṟampalanāṭimālai (U3c.8 = Indien 948.10).
The Civānantamālai (U3c.9 = Indien 948.11).
The Civayōkatīpikai (U3d.1 = Indien 948.12).
The Tiruvuntiyār (U3d.2 = Indien 948.13).
The Civānantamālai (U3e = Indien 948.14).
The Civañānacittiyar Cupaṭcam (U3f = Indien 948.15) (400 stanzas).
The Civañānapōtakam (U3g.1 = Indien 948.16).
The Ñānaveṇpā (U3g.2 = Indien 948.17).
The Cokkanātar Veṇpā (U3h = Indien 948.18) (100 stanzas).
The Ñānacāraveṇpā (U3i = Indien 948.19) (100 stanzas).
The Pakavaṟkītaitālāṭṭu and the Ñānattalāṭṭu (U3j = Indien 948.20-21).
The Civānantamālai appears twice, once complete, once summarised/incomplete (?).

The bundle contains two tables of contents:
An additional table of contents by Ariel's scribe (U1), which lists 21 works, but the Civānantamālai appears twice, as indeed in the bundle.
Another table of contents (U2), which appears to be original to a part of the bundle, lists 17 works, one of which (the Aparōṭca-ātmāṉupava-tīpikai) is presently missing. This table of contents no. 2 stops with the Civañānapōtakam (U3g.1 = Indien 948.16).
The Kurumoḻiviṉāval (U3c.1, Indien 948.3) is named Tirumoḻiviṉāval in the table of contents no. 1 (U1).
The Kurumoḻiviṉāval (U3c.1, Indien 948.3) and the Cacivarṇapōtam (U3c.2 = Indien 948.4) are given in inverted order in the table of contents no. 2 (U2).
The Cukātītacintu (U3c.3 = Indien 948.5) does not appear in the table of contents no. 2 (U2).

The table of contents no. 2 (U2) lists, between the Tiruvuntiyār (U3d.2 = Indien 948.13) and the Civānantamālai (U3e = Indien 948.14), a work now missing in the bundle: the Aparōṭca Āṟtumāṉupavatīpikai). The Tiruvuntiyār (U3d.2 = Indien 948.13) consists in less than one page (f19v = f45v = f127v) and its text stops abruptly at the last line of the page, whereas there is a foliation gap, the next folio being f[1]r = f62r = f145r, where begins the Civānantamālai (U3e = Indien 948.14). A total of 16 folios is thus missing.
Description based on the examination of the original manuscript (January and December 2021).
Dimensions assessed at the time of examination.

title.term: Title Page (additional): Table of Contents no. 1

Collection (9 works): Kurumoḻiviṉāval (Text & Commentary), Cacivarṇapōtam (Text & Commentary), Cukātītacintu, Antariyāka Pūcaiyaṭṭavaṇai, Anuṭṭāṉavakaval, Uṟcakaviḷakkam, Anupūtiviḷakkam, Ciṟṟampalanāṭimālai, Civānantamālai

extent.note: Some folios are smaller, e.g. U3, f105 (365 x 35 mm).

supportDesc.foliation: Up to 3 parallel left-marginal Tamil numerals foliation: Tamil foliation 1-30.1 fo U3a, continued, with gaps, as parallel overall Tamil foliation for U3b (30.2-56), U3c (87-104), U3d (109-127), U3e (145-159), U3f (160-182). U3b has its own independent Tamil foliation (1-27). U3c has 2 series of folios with own independent Tamil foliation. U3d has its own independent Tamil foliation (1-19). U3e has its own independent Tamil foliation (1-16). U3c, U3d and U3e share a second Tamil foliation (5-22, 27-45, 62-77), with gaps of same extent as that of the parallel overall Tamil foliation. U3f has its own independent Tamil foliation (1-23). U3g, U3h, U3i, and U3j have only one single independent Tamil foliation (1-29, 1-5, 1-5, 1-3).

collation.desc: the front cover. Sticker. BnF shelfmark sticker.
1 folio = Title Page (additional): Table of Contents no. 1. No foliation. Verso blank. 550 x 35 mm.
1 folio = Notes + Table of Contents no. 2. The notes consist in a list of cakras with figures. No foliation. 550 x 35 mm.
183 folios = Collection (21 works). Tamil overall foliation.
30 folios = Civappirakācam: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation 1-30.1. Foliation 30 unblackened.
27 folios = Tēvilōkattiram: Text & Commentary. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-27. Parallel overall Tamil foliation 30.2-56.

18 folios = Collection (9 works): Kurumoḻiviṉāval, Cacivarṇapōtam, Cukātītacintu, Antariyāka Pūcaiyaṭṭavaṇai, Anuṭṭāṉavakaval, Uṟcakaviḷakkam, Anupūtiviḷakkam, Ciṟṟampalanāṭimālai, Civānantamālai. Tamil foliation 5-22. Parallel overall Tamil unblackened foliation 87-104. Third Tamil foliation {1}, 2-3 for f97-f99 and 1-5 for f100-f104. f99v blank.
19 folios = Collection (2 works): Civayōkatīpikai + Tiruvuntiyār. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-19. Parallel Tamil foliation 27-45. Parallel overall unblackened Tamil foliation 109-127.
16 folios = Civāṉantamalai. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-16. Tamil foliation [62], 63-77. Parallel overall unblackened Tamil foliation 145-152.1, 152.2-159.
23 folios = Civañānacittiyar Cupaṭcam. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-23. Parallel overall unblackened Tamil foliation 160-182.
30 folios = Collection (2 works): Civañānapōtakam + Ñānaveṇpā. Tamil foliation {1}, 2-27.1, 27.2-29. f26v blank.
3 folios = Collection (2 works): Pakavaṟkītai Tālaṭṭu + Ñāṉattālāṭṭu. Added Tamil foliation 1-3.
1 folio = guard leaf. No foliation. Blank recto verso.

supportDesc.condition: Relatively good state of preservation, despite boreholes.

additions.desc: BnF current shelfmark sticker: INDIEN 948 (front cover, recto).

Sticker written in black black ink (front cover, recto):
S.A.
Divers morceaux
Petits poèmes
Philosophie
"S.A." might stand for "Société asiatique" of Paris, to which Ariel bequeathed his library (1855).

binding.p: Original wood covers. 555 x 40 x 15 mm. Woodstick tied to the string and threaded in one of the sringholes.

origin.origDate: The Civappirakācam (U3a) is internally dated to the year kara of the Jovian cycle, that is, CE 1831-1832, 1771-1772, 1711-1712, etc. See colophon (U3, f30.1v2).

provenance.p: Probably owned by Édouard Ariel (1818-1854). See the typical title-page folio (U1) found with Ariel manuscripts. Bequeathed by Édouard Ariel to Société Asiatique (Rosny 1868, p. 177). Borrowed from BnF by Julien Vinson (1843-1926). See handwritten addition, f2v, no. 948 to Cabaton (1912).

acquisition.p: Received, August 1st, 1866, from the Société Asiatique. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 7 = Dons: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1848-1895, no. 1192. Acquired, June 20th, 1930, from Paul Vinson. See BnF, département des Manuscrits, inventaire 3 = Acquisitions: manuscrits et imprimés documentaires, 1894-1950, no. 13591.

listBibl.bibl: Cabaton, Antoine. 1912. Catalogue sommaire des manuscrits indiens, indo-chinois & malayo-polynésiens. Bibliothèque nationale. Département des manuscrits. Paris: E. Leroux. — See handwritten addition, f2r, no. 948.

encodingDesc.p: General ― Unmarked length of ō and ē supplied. Unmarked puḷḷi supplied. Conjectural reading (text unclear) between parentheses. Supplied reading (text lost) between square brackets. Alternative readings separated by slash. In transliteration ― Unmarked elided overshort u supplied as an apostrophe. Uppercase for initial vowels. Symbols between curly brackets. Abbreviations ― c = column; f = folio; lf = library foliation; lm = left margin; r = recto; rm = right margin; u / U followed by a number = unit (codicological and/or textual); v = verso.
